title: UK’s rarest cars: 1963 Vauxhall Cresta PB, one of only five left on British roads
text:
Someone has to save the cars that were once ubiquitous. “I’ve always liked cars that other people have overlooked,” says Ed Herridge of his 1963 Vauxhall Cresta PB. When new, it was an object of desire to anyone with a need to demonstrate they had “made it”, one that blended flamboyance with respectability.

When the PB debuted in October of 1962, the major talking point was its restrained and even handsome styling befitting a car that according to Vauxhall, “was not revolutionary” but “very nearly perfect”. The 1957-1962 PA-series is arguably the best-remembered Vauxhall, due mainly to its pseudo-US looks, but Luton adopted a far more restrained approach for its successor.

Herridge sums it...
description: Someone has to save the cars that were once ubiquitous.
